column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=The trouble for traditional media is , they do n't own the rights to very much material .
#Text=They operate inside a web of very complex agreements with multiple entities .
#Text=We used to joke at the CBC that the only thing we owned was nature documentaries .
#Text=And even those did n't entirely belong to us .
#Text=So they are very constrained .
#Text=For wikinews all they have to do is credit us with the story to comply with the license
#Text=You mean , they can use your material if they credit you , yes ?
#Text=Yes , a link to us would be nice too
#Text=Yeah , as long as they state its CC-BY-2.5 and give our name , they can use it .
#Text=Can users who have edited Wikinews be respected around real journalists ?
#Text=Will they be turned down because they have written for an online website like Wikinews , which is not particularly fond of the mainstream media , and not traditional media ?
#Text=First , let me say that I do n't think Wikinews and the traditional/mainstream media should consider themselves at all in opposition to each other .
#Text=I think they can peacefully coexist .
#Text=There are some things the mainstream media are very good at , and they are also ( sometimes ) happy to admit their faults .
#Text=And yes , I think Wikinews writers can be respected by real journalists , because the work speaks for itself .
#Text=The one major challenge to that would be the collaborative authorship issue .

#Text=Because as in academia , authorship is significant for professional journalists , and so I think the idea that something was collaboratively authored is hard for traditional journalists to understand .
#Text=Although you have an account on the English wikinews ( User : SueGardner ) , you have never edited .
#Text=One would assume that as a journalist you would use this project .
#Text=Is there any main reason you do n't edit here or do you just not have time ?
#Text=I am just too busy .
#Text=I think there are lots of people who can do as good or better a job than I could , of editing Wikinews .
#Text=But I think I am the only person who is paid to be thinking about the organization as a whole all day every day - so that 's what I do .
#Text=If you could interview anyone for Wikinews who would you like to interview ?
#Text=Did you interview Doris Lessing ?
#Text=Not yet , although we reported on her though ( see Doris Lessing wins Nobel Prize for Literature )
#Text=Okay .
#Text=I read your Doris Lessing story , and I was thinking maybe someone had interviewed her later .
#Text=For me personally , I would love to interview Doris Lessing .
#Text=Do you use Wikinews as a primary source for news , or do you use other mainstream sources , and then look to Wikinews ?
